segments.text: You know , Mary , I feel we meet somewhere before . Where were you born ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I was born in Beijing , but I spent most of my childhood in London .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I had a pretty strict upbringing , and my parents taught at universities so they have extremely high expectations for me .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Where did you go to university ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My parents wanted me to stay in Beijing , but I decided to go back to England . I graduated from University of Newcastle upon Tyne with a degree in Cross Culture Communication .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I am a journalist . I write for China Daily .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Did you know that you wanted to be a journalist right after your graduation ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I didn â€™ t . I started working at a university in London but as time went by , I found I did not really like my job . I decided to explore other fields . Journalism is great fit for me as well as a challenge .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Do you like your current job ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I came to Beijing two years ago looking for new opportunities . I was lucky because my friend introduced me to my current company .
segments.speaker: S2
